Dear Sheffield City Council,
I note that the Council has yet to provide Information in regard of a request that you received on 3 July 2023.
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/l...
I REQUIRE the following information.
1. The number of Information Requests by the Council received in July 2023.
2. The number of said Information Requests received in July 2023, that the council has either provided information in respect of, or confirmed it does hold the information, or confirmed the information held is exempt from disclosure, if any.
3. The number of Council staff, if any, that have received any external training in complying with the Freedom of Information Act and the Environmental Information Regulations.
Yours faithfully,
Bill Ellson

Dear Bill Ellson,
Thank you for your request for information relating to responses to
Information Requests which we received on 02/10/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 30/10/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Bill Ellson,
Thank you for your request for information relating to responses to
Information Requests which we received on 02/10/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. The number of Information Requests by the Council received in July
2023.
167 requests were opened in July 2023.
2. The number of said Information Requests received in July 2023, that the
council has either provided information in respect of, or confirmed it
does hold the information, or confirmed the information held is exempt
from disclosure, if any.
Information Not Held: 11.
Information provided: 89.
Information exempted: 22.
(Withdrawn/duplicate: 3)
3. The number of Council staff, if any, that have received any external
training in complying with the Freedom of Information Act and the
Environmental Information Regulations.
The information you have requested is exempt from disclosure under section
12 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000. Sheffield City Council does
hold the information you have requested. However, we do not record the
information in a format that allows us to produce an electronic report of
this. Therefore, we would have to carry out a manual search of our
records. We estimate that we would need to search at least the records of
315 staff and that it would take 5 minutes to search each record. These
staff are our FOI Service Contacts and legal services staff, which have
CPE/D points to earn each year. We would need to gather information about
external webinars put on by solicitors' firms, either free or part of our
contract, and seminars put on by FOI trainers and commercial
organisations, which we know our staff watch. Then there are the training
videos for new case officers on the ICO website, which our staff are
encouraged to view. Finally, there are the paid for courses from the likes
of Act Now, 2040 Training and PDP to mention a few, which we know staff
have attended. For instance, our last face to face training with an
external trainer was all day with 35 staff. Therefore, it would take us 26
hours to collate the information, which is more than the cost limit of 18
hours or £450 specified in the [1]Freedom of Information and Data
Protection (Appropriate Limit and Fees) Regulations 2004 (SI 2004 No.
3244).
Under section 16 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000, we have a duty to
provide advice and assistance to requesters. If you would like to narrow
down the focus of your request, we would be happy to process your revised
request as a new request for information under the Freedom of Information
Act 2000.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
